Package erjang Description

Central Erjang classes, including representation of data and processes.

Developer's note: The contents of this package is rather diverse; it might be a good idea to move data representation classes to erjang.data and move some support classes to erjang.util.

Data representation

Erlang values are represented in Erjang through the class hierarchy rooted in EObject.
The class hierarchy is depicted below: 

                              +-------+
                              |EObject|
                              +-------+
                                  ^
    ______________________________|____________________________
   |    |    |    |   |       |         |          |           |
   | +-----+ | +----+ | +-------------+ |     +----------+     |
   | |EAtom| | |ERef| | |«EPseudoTerm»| |     |EBitstring|     |
   | +-----+ | +----+ | +-------------+ |     +----------+     |
   |         |        |                 |          ^           |
+------+ +-------+ +--------+      +---------+     |      +---------+
|«EFun»| |«ECons»| |«ETuple»|      |«ENumber»| +-------+  |«EHandle»|
+------+ +-------+ +--------+      +---------+ |EBinary|  +---------+
   ^         ^          ^               ^      +-------+       ^     
   |         |          |            ___|___               ____|___  
+.......+    |     +.......+        |       |             |        |    
:one per:    |     :one per:  +----------+ +-------+  +-------+ +------+
: arity :    |     : arity :  |«EInteger»| |EDouble|  |«EPort»| |«EPID»|
+.......+    |     +.......+  +----------+ +-------+  +-------+ +------+
     ________|________              ^                     ^          ^  
    |       |         |           __|____                 |         _|____________ 
 +-----+ +------+ +--------+     |       |      +-------------+    |              |
 |EPair| |«ESeq»| |EBinList|  +------+ +----+   |EInternalPort|  +------------+ +------------+
 +-----+ +------+ +--------+  |ESmall| |EBig|   +-------------+  |EInternalPID| |EExternalPID|
            ^                 +------+ +----+                    +------------+ +------------+
            |               
    ________|____________________________________________       
   |      |        |           |            |            |      
+----+ +-----+ +-------+ +----------+ +-----------+ +----------+
|ENil| |EList| |EString| |EBigString| |EStringList| |«ELazySeq»|
+----+ +-----+ +-------+ +----------+ +-----------+ +----------+
  • EAtom and ERef represent Erlang atoms and references, respectively.
  • ETuple and EFun represent Erlang tuples and function values, respectively; a concrete subclass exists for each arity. Some of these subclasses are created at runtime, but in general, they are generated as needed at runtime.
  • erjang.EBitstring represents Erlang bit strings. EBinary is a specialization for bitstrings ending on byte boundaries. (This subclass relation is just as in Erlang, cf. erlang:is_bitstring/1 and erlang:is_binary/1.)
  • ECons represents lists (the name is a bit of a misnomer). There are several list representation classes; see below for details.
  • ENumber represents numbers (cf. erlang:is_number/1). Floats are represented by EDouble. Integers are represented by ESmall if they fit into 32 bits, and by EBig otherwise.
  • EHandle represents handles to active objects (entities with inboxes): processes (EPID) and ports (EPort). PIDs are represented differently according to whether the process lives at this node (EInternalPID) or in a remote node (EExternalPID).
  • Finally, EPseudoTerm represents an entity which is not an Erlang term but which nevertheless needs to have EObject type. Examples include EBinMatchState and ETailMarker.

List representation

For performance reasons, Erjang has several different list representations.
The most general representation is using ENil and EPair — for the empty list and non-empty lists, respectively.

Furthermore, the following important special cases are accomodated:

  • Lists which are known to be pure: ESeq and subclasses; EList handles the general case.
  • Pure lists of integers in the range [0;28-1] (Ascii/Latin-1 strings; list equivalent of binaries): EString
  • Pure lists of integers in the range [0;216-1] (Unicode strings): EBigString
  • Lists with a prefix of integers in the range [0;28-1] (I/O-lists): EBinList
  • Pure lists with a prefix of integers in the range [0;28-1] (I/O-lists): EStringList
  • Internal lazily-generated lists (exception stack traces): ELazySeq
